result.execSummary:
The defendant Nazarus Hubbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Conspiracy [Modifiers: Solicitation of], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(4).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  To be paid during period of Extended Supervision  or civil judgment.

Pay costs and fees as to count five. DV surcharge only applies to count 3 on case 2014CF5370.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count five; and consecutive to any other sentences.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs or alcohol.
No violent contact with victim Corida W.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, and consecutive to any other sentences.

on count two.
Count five.
count two

Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Corlinda W.   

AS TO COUNT #5: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS (CONCURRENT to count #2) and CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences) in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS, (CONCURRENT to count #5) and (CONSECUTIVE to any other sentences), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
--- as to count #2.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim, Corlida W.   
* Obtain and maintain employment..
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, surcharge, and supervision fees 
   as determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- pay costs and fees as to count #5. 
   --- dv surcharge only applies to ct. #3 on case 2014CF5370.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
  and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution is set at zero.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.   mld

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Nazarus Hubbert not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Due to branch 4 in trial, Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to branch 4 on 7-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Allowing Deefndant's Telephone, Visitation, and U.S. Mail Custody Privileges to be Reinstated Subject to the No Contact Order, signed 6-3-2015, and filed.   mld
Court ordered that defendant may have contact with parties not listed on the no contact order.   mld

Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #1, #3 and #4, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS #2 and COUNT #5:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-23-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 6-8-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   

Defense Motion to Allow Defendant to Have Contact with Parties Not Listed listed on the No Contact Order is heard and granted by the Court.  mld

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Waive the Security Costs to allow defendant to attend the funeral of his mother on 5-19-2015, is heard and denied by the Court.  Defense counsel will need to follow up with the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department, if any security costs can be waived.   mld

Petition and Order for Funeral Pass, signed and filed.  
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the defendant has permission to attend the funeral of Shirley Hubbert (Mother), on 5-19-2015, at 2031 N. 38th Street, Milwaukee, WI, ONLY if escorted by Milwaukee County Corrections Officers or Sheriff's Deputies.  Order, signed and filed.   mld
Plea date scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Cover letter and plea form and addendum filed.

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Nazarus Hubbert not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  Defense counsel in court to request adjournment of scheduled plea hearing.  No objection by the State.  Case adjourned to 05-28-2015 for plea hearing.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Michael Lee Goode in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Michael Lee Goode in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint regarding the no contact orders and the domestic violence surcharges against defendant on both cases 2011CM5773 and 2012CF3226.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Eric Kradecki.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion for dismissal of count #2 is heard and denied by the Court.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery, offer letter and discovery demand was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-6-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Global offer for cases 2014CF5370 and 2015CF912 was previously emailed to defense counsel, per the State.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for trial: Cases 2014CF5370 and 2015CF912.  On the next date, the Court would reconsider the consolidation of cases if requested by defense counsel, after review of the discovery.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-7-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Corlida W., and all of her children, until further order of the Court.   mld

Upon the request of Attorney Eric Hart (per telephone call), Preliminary Hearing rescheduled from 3-6-2015 at 8:30 am to 3-4-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Attorney Hart advised that the State has been notified of the adjourned date.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court  proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Corlida W and ALL of her children

Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Nazarus Hubbert in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3 & 5.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
